name: Rhythm Interview Prep
description: Quarter 2 midterm benchmark — gauge where students are at

name: Array Bootcamp
description: Intensive practice on array methods and manipulation

name: HTML & CSS Foundations
description: Complete HTML & CSS curriculum from beginner to advanced, covering page structure, forms, selectors, layout, positioning, typography, animations, and responsive design.

name: Rithm Interview Prep — Part 2
description: Slightly more challenging Rithm School interview problems covering objects, arrays, matrices, and simulation
attribution: Advanced interview-style JavaScript exercises covering objects, arrays, matrices, and simulation. Sourced from [Rithm School](https://rithmschool.com). Used under the MIT License.

name: Intro to Classes
description: Six foundational exercises that introduce class syntax, constructors, methods, default params, and constraints — building from a simple Dog up to a BankAccount.

name: Real World Classes
description: Eight practical class exercises — ShoppingCart, TodoList, Gradebook, Playlist, VendingMachine, Library, Timer, and Garage. Each one mirrors a real-world object with meaningful state and constraints.

name: Inheritance & OOP Patterns
description: Six exercises covering extends, super, method overriding, polymorphism, and the EventEmitter pattern — the full inheritance toolkit used in professional JavaScript.

name: OOP Complete Track
description: The full 30-exercise object-oriented programming arc: from basic class syntax through Turing-style mythical creatures, real-world applications, and professional inheritance patterns.

name: Tier 5: RPG Full System
description: Five interacting classes — Item, Inventory, Character, Quest, Party. Composition within composition: Party methods traverse three class boundaries to compute aggregated stats.

name: Tier 3: Functions — Factories, Closures & Composition
description: Scaffold from makeMultiplier to pipe to memoize and curry. Every exercise builds on the last, from returning simple functions to full higher-order composition patterns.

name: Tier 3: Loops — Patterns, Nesting & Problem Solving
description: From loop-built strings to nested 2D arrays to pair-finding. Each step adds one concept: tracking multiple variables, using the index as output, nesting loops, combining loops with conditions.

name: Tier 3: Conditionals — Multi-Variable & Guard Clauses
description: Move beyond single-range branching. Combine two variables, layer three overlapping rules, refactor to guard-clause style, and model state transitions.

name: Tier 3: Strings — Combining, Searching & Encoding
description: titleCase through Caesar cipher — each exercise combines two or more string skills you already have, then introduces one new idea like charCode math or wrapping arithmetic.

name: Tier 3: Objects — Transform, Group & Traverse
description: From transforming every value to grouping arrays, accessing nested paths, and deep merging — each exercise extends the object patterns from Tier 2 one step further.

name: Tier 3: Implement It Yourself — flatMap, zip, groupBy
description: You built myMap, myFilter, myReduce in Tier 2. Now implement flatMap (map + flatten), zip (pair two arrays), and groupBy (reduce into an object). Each extends a pattern you already know.
